snippet: Camille Cosby, Bill Cosby’s wife of nearly 51 years, has spoken out for decades against images of African-Americans as seen on television and in other media.
abstract: Camille O Cosby has been staunchest supporter of her husband Bill Cosby in face of accusations of sexual abuse by multiple women; frames her defense of him in terms of media's unfair representation of African-Americans, subject she has been vocal about for many years.

byline.original: By SERGE F. KOVALESKI and COLIN MOYNIHAN
byline.contributor: Susan Beachy. Elisa Cho and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Camille Cosby, Bill Cosby’s wife of nearly 51 years, has spoken out for decades against images of African-Americans as seen on television and in other media.

headline.main: Well Before Scandals, Cosby’s Wife Faulted Media Treatment of Blacks
headline.print_headline: Well Before Scandals, Cosby’s Wife Faulted Media Treatment of Blacks
